alert.note: Alert for Bienville; Natchitoches; Red River; Winn (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 23 at 5:07PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EASTERN RED RIVER...NORTHERN NATCHITOCHES...SOUTHERN BIENVILLE AND NORTHWESTERN WINN PARISHES THROUGH 600 PM CST... At 507 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles south of Ringgold to 8 miles east of Coushatta to 6 miles west of Campti to 13 miles west of Natchitoches to 9 miles north of Many. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Natchitoches, Campti, Allen, Martin, Clarence, Goldonna, Saline, Lucky, Ashland, Castor, Powhatan, Lake End, Grand Ecore, Womack, Friendship, Black Lake, Chestnut, Clear Lake, Creston, and Marthaville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
